message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper is about image captioning, which is a computer vision task, so it is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) category. Additionally, the paper proposes a novel model that measures consistency between captioning predicted attentions and intrinsic visual attentions, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques, so it could also belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) category. The paper also introduces a new loss function to improve the attention mechanism, which is a machine learning technique, so it could belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category. Furthermore, the paper uses the COCO dataset, which is a popular benchmark for image captioning, so it could belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) category. Finally, the paper also uses a genealogical dataset, which involves historical photos and stories, so it could belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) category, which deals with the organization and retrieval of information.
